author: sky.cactus
content: I don't validator exit because once I do I cannot withdraw the ETH,

author: sky.cactus
content: So it is better to just let it bleed so I can go back and fiddle with it later at least.

author: sky.cactus
content: To put it another way, Goerli ETH doesn't have long term value, but being able to pop in to Pyrmont to fiddle with something (e.g., test a new client) does have value.  Rather than having to go and find more Goerli ETH every time I want to test something, it is easier to just put 32 ETH in and let it sit and bleed than to try to find 32 ETH once every week or two.
